definition: plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
stratagem of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift plan/interim step

sentences.english: The accommodation for the press was makeshift at best.
sentences.chinese: 迁就新闻界充其量只是个权宜之计。

sentences.english: These may end up being stop-gap measure.
sentences.chinese: 这些可能在最终都只是一些权宜之计。

sentences.english: The bailout bill is a classic example of expediency over effectiveness.
sentences.chinese: 援助账单是一个权宜之计的经典范本。

sentences.english: But both are the refuge of political and economic opportunists.
sentences.chinese: 但两者都是政治及经济机会主义者的权宜之计。

sentences.english: It is what it is, a matter of expediency.
sentences.chinese: 但就是这样，一个权宜之计。

sentences.english: A thinking person realizes that the right way and the expedient way are not always the same.
sentences.chinese: 聪明人明白正确的方法和权宜之策是不同的。

sentences.english: So the drugs are kind of a "Band-Aid solution, " Khalili explained.
sentences.chinese: 哈利利博士解释说，所以这些药物只是某种权宜之计。

sentences.english: But to date, there have been only short-term, stop-gap measures.
sentences.chinese: 但迄今为止，政府只采取了短期的权宜之计。

sentences.english: But that would be crassly expedient.
sentences.chinese: 但那将是一个愚蠢的权宜之计。
